meanings.definition: Establish (an attitude, habit, or belief) so firmly that change is very difficult or unlikely.
meanings.sent1: Growing up in a strict household entrenches the importance of discipline.
meanings.sent2: The constant repetition of positive affirmations entrenches a sense of self-worth.
meanings.sent3: Trying to change Grandpa's daily routine only entrenches his stubbornness!
meanings.sent4: The fear of failure entrenches itself in her mind like a deep-rooted tree.
meanings.sent5: The haunting melody of the song entrenches itself in my memory.

meanings.definition: Establish (a person or their authority) in a position of great strength or security.
meanings.sent1: The king entrenches his power by surrounding himself with loyal advisors.
meanings.sent2: The new CEO quickly entrenches herself as a respected leader in the company.
meanings.sent3: The cat entrenches its authority over the house by claiming the best spot on the couch.
meanings.sent4: The fortress entrenches itself on the hill, a symbol of invincibility.
meanings.sent5: The champion boxer entrenches his dominance in the ring with each victorious match.
